page.title: 19History in Industries Lost
page.content: Years ago Bridgerule was a thriving community with several small industries. Life and work was centred around the village with very few people going outside for employment. There were two working quarries from which stone for many local buildings was obtained. There was no running water for many years and up until fairly recently water was fetched from an underground pipe which carried water from a spring. There is an old aqueduct in Littlebridge Hill which collapsed several years ago. This carried the Bude canal and there were two wharfs connected with it. Other industries that have been lost include sawmills, a wheelwright, blacksmiths, a boot and shoe maker and a butcher's shop. Also there used to be a working watermill which ground all the local grain for flour.
